summary: Dive into the concept of ecosystems, both in biological terms and as a metaphor for human organizations. Traditionally bound by space and time, ecosystems now describe evolving organizational structures that transcend these limits. This shift is driven by the desire for more organic and less hierarchical frameworks. Topics include ecosystem architecture, drawing from various disciplines to sustain these advanced systems.
excerpt: The term ecosystem has evolved beyond its biological origins to describe modern human organizations that transcend spatio-temporal constraints, reflecting a shift towards less hierarchical structures.
